abstract: At a recent conference, Paul E. Steiger,  editor at large of The Wall Street Journal, conducted a question-and-answer session with himself about Rupert Murdoch’s takeover of Dow Jones.
snippet: At a recent conference, Paul E. Steiger,  editor at large of The Wall Street Journal, conducted a question-and-answer session with himself about Rupert Murdoch’s takeover of Dow Jones.
lead_paragraph: Paul E. Steiger, former managing editor of The Wall Street Journal and now editor at large of the paper, was a keynote speaker at the annual convention of the Asian American Journalists Association in Miami and had intended to discuss the future of journalism.

abstract: Traditionally the sandbox of publishers, the editorial pages at The Wall Street Journal won guarantees of independence in Rupert Murdoch’s bargain to win control of Dow Jones.
snippet: Traditionally the sandbox of publishers, the editorial pages at The Wall Street Journal won guarantees of independence in Rupert Murdoch’s bargain to win control of Dow Jones.
lead_paragraph: Some of the winners in the News Corporation’s purchase of The Wall Street Journal were less obvious than others.

headline.main: Murdoch Gives In, So to Speak
headline.print_headline: Murdoch Gives In, So to Speak
